## Libraries
```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```

## Data
```{r}
# all years (cleaned data)
hrs <- read.csv('../../data/hrs.csv')
```

## Basic summaries by time
```{r}
# those that report income all four years
hrs_id <- hrs %>% 
  group_by(person_id, years) %>% 
  summarise(income_responses = sum(!is.na(income))) %>%
  filter(income_responses != 0) %>% 
  group_by(person_id) %>%
  count() %>% filter(n == 4) %>% 
  pull(person_id)

# randomly sample
set.seed(47)
hrs_id <- sample_n(data.frame(hrs_id), 15)
hrs_subset <- hrs %>% filter(person_id %in% hrs_id$hrs_id)
```

## Visualize trends over time (start with one variable)
```{r, eval=FALSE}
# plot income by time
ggplot(hrs_subset, aes(x = years, y = income, group = person_id)) + 
  geom_line()
```
